name: rack
description: a modular Ruby webserver interface

commit.message:
Add Locking middleware

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Trim IE's full file path in multipart uploads

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Rack::Session update part 3
Updated Memcache and tests in accordance with changes to Abstract::ID
Support for :drop option added to Memcache
Adjusted mutex locking dependant on rack.multithread in Memcache and Pool
Adjusted session merging algorithms in Memcache and Pool
Abstract::ID#set_session and #get_session arguments adjusted

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Addition of HttpOnly cookie support to Rack::Response

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Major update to Rack::Auth::OpenID
Includes accessor methods for Rack::Request and an auth middleware

Full test update.
Full documentation update.
Reduced complexity of options, compensated with additional flexibility
through overriding methods.

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Adjusted Session::Pool#generate_id to prevent collisions.
Pool#get_session appropriately reduced, mutex only writes and selective reads
Pool#set_session looks for :drop in 'rack.session.options' to remove a session from the main pool
ID#set_session will regenerate a session id if the :renew option is present
ID#set_session will ignore :defer if :renew is true
Session::Abstract::ID allows for deferring from setting a cookie in a response by using the :defer option.
Removal of :key in default options, default is inlined.

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Add multipart tests for input that does not support rewinding

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Add multipart test with binary file

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Fix brittle test after Rack::Request memoization

The Content-Length changed due to how Rack::Request memoizes
itself in the env.

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Add tests for multipart uploads. Also ensure multipart parser tries to rewind the input stream.

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Explicitly require request, response, and utils

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Updates to session systems.
ID brought closer in line to Rack::Session::Cookie
Adjusted to be compatible with Rack::Utils::Context
Tests updated and adjusted

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>

Simplification of Rack::Utils::Context
Adjustment of tests and documentation

Signed-off-by: Diego Scataglini <dwebsubmit@gmail.com>
fixed wrong reference to Rack::Utils in rdocs

Update Content-Length in Response#write, not in #finish. Spec.

* This means that the absence of the Content-Length header
  can actually be used by the ContentLength middleware to
  figure out if it should run.

* There is no "default" Content-Length.
Fix directory traversal exploits in Rack::File and Rack::Directory
Last minute README fixes
Fix last glitches
Set release date
Store original HTTP method in MethodOverride middleware

Fix typos in auth/openid
Reported by Robert Adkins <radkins@technetra.com>
Rack::File::MIME_TYPES is now Rack::Mime::MIME_TYPES
Another changes addition
Update gemspec
Update thanks
Update copyright
Update README
In URLMap, entries without host name should come first
Marshall of String changed in 1.9
Rewrite Response test to use a well-defined #each
Array#to_a changed in 1.9
Constants are symbols in 1.9
Shuffle scopes for 1.9
Fix spec_rack_response for 1.9
Fix webrick handler for ruby 1.9.1
Merge commit 'official/master'
Add trailing slash to the alternative gem server
Support X-Http-Method-Override header in MethodOverride middleware

Don't leak absolute paths in error messages
Reported by Yonghui Luo.
Implement HeaderHash#merge! and HeaderHash#merge

Use HeaderHash where header case should be insensitive

The ConditionalGet, ContentLength, Deflator, and ShowStatus
middleware components were reading/checking headers case
sensitively.

Non-normalizing HeaderHash with case-insensitive lookups

This is a backwards incompatible change that removes header name
normalization while attempting to keep most of its benefits. The
header name case is preserved but the Hash has case insensitive
lookup, replace, delete, and include semantics.
Don't try to rewind CGI input
Reformat Rack::Deflater code
Rack::Deflator respects the no-transform cache control directive
Update README
Idiomize code
Added specification for Rack::Request memoization.
Updated spec with the new size of the content length based on the new environment variable data included with the Rack::Request instantiation memoization.
Added Rack::Request initialization memoization to reduce repetitive instantiation cost.
Rewind input after parsing request form vars
Delegate Lint::InputWrapper#rewind to underlying IO object
use Set instead of Array for STATUS_WITH_NO_ENTITY_BODY

Rack::ContentLength tweaks ...

 * Adds a Content-Length header only when the body is of knownable
   length (String, Array).
 * Does nothing when Transfer-Encoding header is present in
   response.
 * Uses a Set instead of an Array for status code lookup (linear
   search through 102 elements seemed expensive).

Fixed Rack::Deflater to handle responses with Last-Modified header

* There was a bug when performing gzip compression where the
  Last-Modified response header was assumed to be a Time object,
  and passed directly to Zlib::GzipWriter#mtime, causing an exception
  since it is always a String.

  This fix parses the Last-Modified header using Time.httpdate and
  returns a Time obejct, which can be safely passed to
  Zlib::GzipWriter#mtime.
Do not add Content-Encoding for a response without and entity body
Updated Rack::Deflater spec helper to allow setting the default status

Moved STATUS_WITH_NO_ENTITY_BODY into Rack::Utils

* Removed duplicate constant from Rack::ContentLength and Rack::Lint
Added Accept-Encoding to HTTP Vary header
Merge commit 'rtomayko/methodoverride'
Fix MethodOverride error when POST has no _method param
Add autoload for Thin handler
Add Thin handler
Add ContentLength middleware
fixing camping bug. see gist:26011
Correct status code language to follow RFC 2616

Improve session id security: Make session id size configurable, raise the default size from 32 bits to 128 bits, and refactor to allow for easy monkey patching the actual session id generation. Modified version according to feedback.

Add support for Secure and HttpOnly flags to session cookies. Set HttpOnly flag by default, since normally, there is no need to read a Rack session from JavaScript in the browser. Do not set the Secure flag by default, since that breaks if the application is not served over TLS.

Avoid slurping or parsing request body on PUT requests

Uploading a large file via the HTTP PUT method causes
`@env["rack.input"].read' to be called inside the POST method.  This
means the entire file is slurped into memory and was needlessly causing
my Sinatra process to eat up 300M+ for some uploads I've been doing.

Use the universally supported select event handler for lighttpd.

* freebsd-kqueue is obviously not supported on Linux.

When calling map, create another object of the same class.

* This allows one to extend Rack::Builder to create specialized Rack
  DSLs.
Silence Net::HTTP warning

Updated the tests to use net/http since open-uri doesn't stream responses.

Oh, and now the tests actually pass.

Allow streaming with the Mongrel Handler.

Write directly to the socket instead of keeping it in the Mongrel Response body.
Send the status/headers up front.
Add tests for streaming with Mongrel.
Implemented Rack::Head, modified Rack::Lint to ensure responses to HEAD requests have empty bodies

Fix header emission for WEBrick and Set-Cookie
Found by Michael Fellinger.
This does not fix Set-Cookie2, Warning, or WWW-Authenticate, because
WEBrick has no way to have duplicates for them.

Test that Rack::Session::Cookie ignores tampered with session cookies
by Christoffer Sawicki

Add secure cookies
Proposed by necrodome.
Empty is if Content-Length is 0, [''] ain't empty?
Rewrite Rack::Builder tests to avoid race-conditions
Added another example demonstrating the Rack::Builder.app method.
Added spec for application initialization to be performed only once.
Implemented Rack::Builder.app and added specs.

Add :secure option for set_cookie
By Brad Hilton.

ConditionalGet middleware (Last-Modified/Etag)

Adapted from Michael Klishin's implementation for Merb:
http://github.com/wycats/merb-core/tree/master/lib/merb-core/rack/middleware/conditional_get.rb

Add MethodOverride middleware to allow browsers to fake PUT and DELETE methods
Update emongrel and add swiftiplied mongrel

Update Rack::File

  * Fix trouble with wrong Content-Length if File.size returns 0
  * Use Rack::Mime
  * Split _call into methods for easier subclassing

Based on a patch by Michael Fellinger.

New version of Rack::Directory

* Handles symlinks
  * Less disk access
  * Uses UTF8
  * Human-readable filesize from Bytes to Terabytes
  * Uses Rack::File as app by default
  * Does a File.expand_path on the
  * +root+ argument
  * Splits up the _call
  * method for easier
  * subclassing
  * Use new Rack::Mime

Based on a patch by Michael Fellinger.

Add Rack::Mime, a module containing a MIME-type list and helpers
Proposed and implemented by Michael Fellinger.

Make Rack::Lint::InputWrapper delegate size method to underlying IO object.

See http://snurl.com/3nesq: Lint was breaking file uploads in a Merb app.

darcs-hash:20080525143330-4fc50-229a17902d777d9b145e8809523a5c37f8a6fbb7.gz

Bug fix for Tempfile POST bodies under Ruby 1.8

The Tempfile class in Ruby 1.8 doesn't implement the == method correctly.
This causes Rack::Requests to re-parse the input (when the input is a
Tempfile) each time the POST method is called, this in turn raises an
EOFError because the input has already been read.

One example of when this happens is when handling large POST requests
(e.g. file uploads) under Mongrel.

This issue only effects Ruby 1.8 (tested against 1.8.6).  Ruby 1.9 does
not suffer from this issue (presumably due to changes in the Delegate
implementation.)

darcs-hash:20080327110953-ea3b8-44b6f22da80c9dae70dcd61adc43111547371daf.gz

memcache.rb - Fixed immortal key bug, updated tests

keys, even if deleted in the current session.

darcs-hash:20080317105627-4fc50-5166a788291ae95c18e19ba4d346874e2c98beb1.gz

Fix that Request assumes form-data even when Content-Type says otherwise

Fixes cases where accessing Request#params causes the body to be read and
processed as form-data improperly. For example, consider the following
request:

    PUT /foo/bar?baz=bizzle HTTP/1.1
    Content-Type: text/plain

    This is not form-data.

When Rack::Request gets ahold of the corresponding environment, and the
application attempts to access the "baz" query string param, the body is read
and interpreted as form-data. If the body is an IOish object, this causes the
offset to be forwarded to the end of file.

The patch prevents the Request#POST method from going into the body unless the
media type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded, multipart/form-data, or not
specified.

While here, added a few unrelated helper methods to Request that I've found
particularly useful in Rack apps: #content_length, #head?, and #content_charset.

Tests and doc included for all changes.

darcs-hash:20080311111155-f4dbf-93145953084e00ca2404ba225ac8c49e5c055c9b.gz

Alteration of Mongrel.run for Mongrel based routing

With the passing of the :map option Mongrel.run will handle the passing of a
Hash or URLMap rather than a standard rack app. The mapping provided by the
passed object will be used to register uris with the mongrel instance.

Hashes should only have absolute paths for keys and apps for values.

URLMaps will be filtered if the :Host options is specified, or the mapping's
host is set.

name: python-module-for-puppet
description: Python module for Puppet, using easy_install for module control.

commit.message:
Adding an optional $version argument to pymod.
If $version is set, pass "$name==$version" to easy_install.

This allows python-modules-for-puppet to be used when you need an older version of a module.
Moved files to /var/puppet/python.
Added link to github.
Put some text in the README.
Initial simple Python class. Includes PEAK's ez_setup.py. TODO: remove it.

commit.message: updates
changed svnst: it's supposed to be "deleted" instead of "removed"
removed -ify color methods
svn status display with diff summary

Revert "made the SvnLog do it's own displaying"

This reverts commit f67b86379b1d08dc45241b56f78ddef049cd1418.
made the SvnLog do it's own displaying
allow svn log command line options
view a prettier, slimmer subversion log
go to RAILS_ROOT from anywhere in a rails project directory
checked in svn:ignore file copier (handy for rails branching)
updates to gen-autocomplete.sh
updates and additions (rakes, color-test, and autodoc are new)
added lstree script, handy for listing the contents of project folders from the command line
created remap for easy symlinking on the command line
made sure svnadd adds by default
added svnadd, modified rgrep. still don't really like it, maybe some tests or docs would be useful?
Updated doc string.
added svn rake tasks
added gen-autocomplete.sh, autocompletion for rake, raket (aliased 'rake RAILS_ENV=test'), cap and script/generate
[add_key]: Create ~/.ssh directory on remote server if it doesn't already exist
Changed format of README to textile.
Added rgrep, a wrapper for grep intended to make it easier to search rails projects (by omitting .svn and .log files).  Updated the README to describe each utility.
add_key and psgrep added to toolbox.

comments.body: Hey Adam, this looks like great material for a blog post.  I think many people would find this script very helpful.

What are you referring to when you say you don't really like it?  The svnadd script?  The rgrep script (which I think should probably just be an alias in a .profile script)?  Or the concept of this toolbox in the first place?

fyi, your changes to rgrep break it on mac.  The exclude-dir option is unrecognized.  I've reverted my local copy.

This has gotten me thinking more and more about what this toolbox should really consist of.  Perhaps at its core, it should actually be a set of organized .profile scripts (some geared towards ubuntu, others towards osx, etc).  Going to think about this a bit more...

[sql/updates/2008_11_11_01_mangos_db_script_string.sql sql/updates/2008_11_11_02_mangos_scripts.sql] Implement localization support for db script command SCRIPT_COMMAND_TALK.

Now db script command strings stored in `db_script_string (mangos_string like table). Text field `datatext` replace by int field `dataint` that store index in `db_script_string` table. Indexes must be 2000000000+ (for avoid conflicts with mangos_string indexes). Changes required DB support and SCRIPT_COMMAND_TALK will not work with old data until fixing in DB.

name: acts_as_versioned
description: ActiveRecord plugin for versioning your models.

commit.message: Added ActiveRecord dependency to gem
Release minior 0.6.1 version.
Add assert_sql support in boot.rb. Also changed core lib to order by the has many versions association with the version_column, support with tests.
Few copy changes.
Remove #versions_count really.
Changing gemspec around a bit.
Adding a gem spec and pusing a new "me" release for 0.6.0.
Create rake test and test_dbs tasks.
Updating the doc wraps a bit.
Update the VersionedTest to test method syntax.

Finally got tests running with the dir structure I want.
Getting the new AAVTestCase setup.
Moving migrations back to test dir.
Move migrations to test/lib.
Moving to a test/lib based directory structure with a boot and AAV test case based from ActiveRecord's case.

Clean up old old code and start move towards new gem
add extra LockedPage field so that it would save even if LockedPage#title had not updated
fix bug so that create_versioned_table doesn't attempt to create duplicate tables
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/francis/acts_as_versioned
create version table on the fly if missing, use proper version column name when checking for existence, and add index automatically
Gem::manage_gems is deprecated, (rubygems 1.3, http://blog.segment7.net/articles/2008/09/26/rubygems-1-3-0)
cleanup deprecated comments, and map if_changed fields up front one time
allow non_versioned_columns to be passed in as an option
clean up use of class attribute
tweaks to make the version_column name work on both the parent and version table
do not version #created_at or #created_on
#save_version? is always false in after_save
favor after_save callbacks, its easier to force tasks to run before or after after_save callbacks
fixed the problem where if_changed only triggered if all listed columns were changed

* (16 Jun 2008) Backwards Compatibility is overrated (big updates for rails 2.1)

  * Remove last traces of #non_versioned_fields
  * Remove AR::Base.find_version and AR::Base.find_versions, rely on AR association proxies and named_scope
  * Remove #versions_count, rely on AR association counter caching.
  * Remove #versioned_attributes, basically the same as AR::Base.versioned_columns
re-remove default order by clause, see 177276643fce38c752004fd81614b8af5ac1587f
Modified acts_as_versioned to work with ActiveRecord's dirty attribute checking.
Modified acts_as_versioned to work with ActiveRecord's dirty attribute checking.
Modified acts_as_versioned to work with ActiveRecord's dirty attribute checking.
My changes to date

Renamed :changed_attributes to :altered attributes to prevent clashes with new dirty attribute checking in ActiveRecord.
Updated the tests to run on rails 2.1
Prevents conflicting order by clauses, e.g. "ORDER BY version desc, version"

name: phpdoctor
description: PHPDoctor is an attempt to create a simpler and faster PHPDoc (Javadoc style comment parser for PHP) that produces standards compliant HTML.

commit.message:
Update phpdoctor.ini

Change default formatter to HTML standard formatter
Updated Markdown requirement to 1.3
Modern doclet added
Getting contents of a file adjusted to be not HTML specific and not to mix in HTML markup
Markdown formatter adjusted to use autoloaded library
Composer file added
Put test data into suitable namespaces
New markdown format readme for Github
Merge branch 'traits'
More namespace test cases
Put test traits into test package
Trait support in standard doclet
Added missing parser trait methods
Merge branch 'master' into traits

Look for default ini file in install path rather than cwd
Added executable file without .php extension
Set correct package doccomment for Github doclets

Renamed default ini file to phpdoctor.ini
Fixed some PHP5 strict errors from phpdoc.php
Added bin direfctive to composer file
Parser support for PHP5.4 traits
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/JeyDotC/phpdoctor into JeyDotC-master
Increment version to 2.0.5
Update standard doclet HTML doctype to HTML5 doctype
Reformatted code as per PSR-2
Support multiple asterisks. Pull request 69.

Added composer vendor path to include path so as to allow simpletest to be found anywhere in include path too.
Don't recreate output dir when clearing it before each test since PHPDoctor will do this itself
Assign method return by reference changed to value due to deprecated warning in PHP5

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/DerManoMann/phpdoctor into DerManoMann-master

issue.body:
...be ommitted from output.

To further illustrate the problem consider the following files parsed in the order listed below:
1. **MyInterface1.php:**
   
    `interface MyInterface1 { ... }`
2. **MyClass.php:**
   
   `class MyClass implements MyInterface1, MyInterface2 { ... }`
3. **MyInterface2.php**
   
   `interface MyInterface2 { ... }`

In the described scenario, the list of implemented interfaces for MyClass will not contain MyInterface1

issue.title: Participate in DocSpec
issue.body:
Hi,

I currently worked out a specification to make results of DocTools interoperable. This is completely new and the spec is just one day old. The idea of this spec is, that doctools deliver their output in this interoperable format and generating the output can be done by others, that don't want to work on the parsing part.

The benefits would be:
- End users can choose whatever doctool they want and which output generator they want.
- Doctool developers can focus on parsing the code, generate a standardised output and leave the output generation to the end users (doesn't that sound like less work for you?)

My blog post with my motivation for creating this: http://gos.si/blog/docspec-as-interoperable-file-format-between-doctools

As I said the DocSpec is not older than a day, you are invited to join here. Also if you feel like this idea suits your doctool, feel free to jump over to express your interesst in participating as an implementor. 

The DocSpec is on github, ready to fork: https://github.com/gossi/docspec

Thank you
gossi

issue.title: Interface implementations not shown
issue.body:
Interfaces are recognized during the doc generation and shown in the navigation, which is fine. They are not connected from the classes that implement them and vice versa. So:
`class A implements MyInterface`
In Javadoc this connection is shown on the class page. Saying this class implements these interfaces.
On the other side, Javadoc displays "All known implementing Classes" on each Interface.

issue.title: Documentation of special behaviour of magic methods
issue.body:
Because of the possibility to use __callStatic or __call, there should be a @method annotation which allows the developer to document these things.
In addition to that, @property(-read/-write) should be included into the fields table with the keyword final if only read access is allowed and for write only something else. Write only for a property is bad practise, but PHP offers you that possibility...

issue.title: Inheritance problem
issue.body:
JavaDoc uses the documentation of the next super class/interface where a doc is available if no documentation is made for an implemented or overridden method, but does not do that!

See this answer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3401642/how-do-i-make-javadoc-inheritance-work-for-external-apis-with-maven2

issue.title: New Bugs
issue.body:
First of all, the generation does not work properly for me because of a problem in inheritDocTag.php on line 73...

PHP Fatal error:  Call to a member function text() on a non-object in ...\phpdoctor\classes\inheritDocTag.php on line 73
PHP Stack trace:
PHP   1. {main}() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\phpdoc.php:0
PHP   2. PHPDoctor->execute() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\phpdoc.php:55
PHP   3. Standard->standard() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\classes\phpDoctor.php:1139
PHP   4. ClassWriter->classWriter() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\standard.php:166
PHP   5. HTMLWriter->_processInlineTags() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\classWriter.php:190
PHP   6. InheritDocTag->text() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\htmlWriter.php:302

After this, I get a lot of HTML output and then the error again.

Fatal error: Call to a member function text() on a non-object in ...\phpdoctor\classes\inheritDocTag.php on line 73

Call Stack:
    0.0006     335016   1. {main}() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\phpdoc.php:0
   59.7188   58986512   2. PHPDoctor->execute() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\phpdoc.php:55
   59.7291   59869920   3. Standard->standard() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\classes\phpDoctor.php:1139
   71.0484   59962832   4. ClassWriter->classWriter() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\standard.php:166
   76.7687   60155936   5. HTMLWriter->_processInlineTags() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\classWriter.php:190
   76.7692   60157608   6. InheritDocTag->text() D:\Downloads\phpdoctor\doclets\standard\htmlWriter.php:302

Not every class or interface is documented, some files are missing.
There are also some other problems i just noticed. If a class/interface is used somewhere, with the fact that it is not imported with the use-keyword because it is in the same package, and somewhere else a class/interface with the same name exists, then it can cause problems. This means in my special case, that there are two interfaces, blabla\cache\Cache and blublu\cache\Cache which are both used like that:

namespace blabla\cache;
class A implements Cache{...}

namespace blublu\cache;
class B implements Cache{...}

Now is the problem that the documentation site of class B is using blabla\cache\Cache and not the right one.

The next thing is, that when I allow different return/parameter types like a simple string and an OOP String like that:

@param \oop\String|string $value The string

Then it does not create a link to the class.

If a classes implement more that one interface, then only one is shown in the doc. Also the methods which these interfaces offer are not included.
If the inheritance is like that:

interface A{}

abstract class B implements A{}

class C extends B{}

Then in C is no documentatino about the interface A!

The field summary is formatted wrong, the left column gets about 50% of the width and this looks strange. I don't know if a link is created to the class doc for throws annotations but in the old version it is not.

A nice feature would be if classes which implement interfaces are mentioned in the doc of the interfaces, this would be more java like with links:

Direct Known Subclasses/Implementations ...

issue.title: {@inheritDoc} doesn't support multiple levels of inheritage
issue.body:
If a method/class is overwritten/extended multiple times with both sublalsses using {@inheritDoc}, the tag is not resolved.
Instead, the {@inheritDoc} of the respective parent class is used.

The code would need to go up the class hierarchy until it finds the first non {@inheritDoc} documentation block.

issue.title: Feature request - regenerate docs only for modified files
issue.body:
We are now running PHPDoctor as a nightly cron job on our code base. Since it's large, this takes several hours.

One neat feature would be the ability to say "only regenerate documentation for files that git shows as changed."

I realize this would be complicated - you'd have to store a record of parent-child class relationships on disk, I imagine - but I thought I'd mention the idea.

issue.title: missing namespace handling in DocBlock
issue.body:
As it is now, unqualified / relative class names in a DocBlock seem to be resolved relative to the namespace root:

namespace A;
...
- @return SomeClass

PHPDoctor interprets this as \SomeClass. It would be more "intuitive" (and conforming to javadoc spec, IMHO) if it would be interpreted as \A\SomeClass. If the coder wanted to refer to \SomeClass, he could/should write so...

Also:
use some/namespace as b;
- @return b/SomeClass
  should be resolved.

How should those be documented? I suppose, the full/absolute class name woud be best - but I'm not sure.

issue.title: Equal classnames in different namespaces result in endless loop
issue.body:
SPL class: \LogicException
my class: \HPO\XQP\LogicException extends \LogicException

debug doclet works, default servlet enters an endless loop in packageWriter.php:239 (_buildTree). Result is segfault if memory is exhausted.

Problem: From a quick glance at the code, it seems the function is called for \HPO\XQP\LogicException, looks for a superclass named 'LogicException' (note missing namespace)  and finds \HPO\XQP\LogicException (itself) in that search.... This results in an endless tree to build.

Merge branch 'before_whitespace'
Cleanup the Amazon S3 establish_connection call to accept all aws-s3 options.

Added a 'persistent' amazon s3 connection config parameter to turn off persistent connections if necessary.  The default is the same as the default for the aws-s3 gem, which is to keep persistent connections.

Strip images of all profiles and comments by default. This is the same as "Save for Web" option provided by Photoshop. Picture quality is not affected, but savings are important for small thumbnails i.e. 40kb vs 6kb. An option is provided to disable the feature.

No change if you use Imagescience as it does not support stripping (the underlying FreeImage library knows about EXIF but the ruby wrapper does not).

Fixed a discrepancy in the comments for image_science_processor.rb where it said it was RMagick instead of Image Science.
Added GD Processor and accompanying tests

Can't rescue CompilationError directly: must check the exception's class name instead.

CompilationError is only available if RubyInline was loaded.
Resize to a 1x1 image minimum in the RmagickProcessor.

Also resuce CompilationError when loading the processors.

This prevents ImageScience from causing a system failure if FreeImage can't be found/compiled.

name: net-couchdb
description: Perl interface for CouchDB

commit.message:
Support include_docs in View API

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Support the new _bulk_docs API

As of r753448, CouchDB has changed the semantics and interface for the
_bulk_docs API.  It no longer does much conflict checking.  Successful
document updates are now reported as an arrayref of hashes.  It used
to be reported as a hash in which the new_revs key contained an
arrayref of hashes.

This makes all the tests pass again for the current CouchDB trunk.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

It's OK if test databases can't be deleted

If a test deletes the test database in the course of its verification,
the testing framework won't be able to delete it.  There's really no
reason to throw an exception in that case.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Support new _design/foo/_view/viewname URI

This makes all the tests pass as of CouchDB trunk r752194

Adjust for CouchDBs new handling of '/'

CouchDB no longer requires that the internal '/' in a design document
name be URI encoded.  The code still works as it stands, but it costs
an extra (unnecessary) HTTP request to follow a 301 redirect.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Encode search parameters key, startkey and endkey

Values of search parameters key, startkey and endkey are now encoded
to JSON unless the value is a reference to a scalar.   Referenced
scalars are not encoded in the request to the server.  This allows one
to use Perl data structures as keys for a search.

Signed-off-by: Roman K. Belikin <roman@csmile.ru>

Another HTTP status code adjustment

CouchDB now responds with HTTP status code 412 when trying to create a
database that already exists.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

DB::documents to fetch multiple documents

Use the new include_docs and keys arguments for views to fetch
multiple documents (and their contents) with a single HTTP request.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Test for CouchDB's new status codes

CouchDB now uses HTTP status code 409 to indicate certain error
conditions instead of status code 412.  This updates the tests to
reflect the change.

Thanks to Roman K. Belikin <roman@csmile.ru> for his initial patch in
this area.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Update documentation to reflect 90b158c

The previous commit changed the code, but it didn't update the
documentation to match.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Rename count parameter to limit

This reflects a recent change in the CouchDB API.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Don't reset the pointer when calling first

There doesn't appear to be a good use case for doing this.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Signed-off-by: Ask Bjørn Hansen <ask@develooper.com>

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.com>

operations about 20% faster

Allow regular documents to have ids with slashes

Make test creating invalid db name pass

Since there could be many possible causes for a 500 error, look for
the specific Erlang atom that indicates that the database name was
invalid.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
$ENV{NET_COUCHDB_DB} variable to use a specific database for the tests when in DEBUG mode
ignore ~ and .bak files

Rudimentary support for attachments

Send UTF-8 encoded JSON to the CouchDB server

Introduce Net::CouchDB::DB::clear method

Change the version number pattern yet again

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Avoid closure var in END { }

Rename _public_data to data

This provides a public API for accessing the document as a hashref.
This is often clearer than accessing the document as an overloaded
hash.  For example, the following are equivalent:

    print Dumper( \%$document );
    print Dumper( $document->data );

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Add DB->document_exists method

This method allows one to determine whether a document with a given
ID exists in the database.  It can be especially useful when the
document might be large and fetching the entire document to check
existence would be overkill.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Stringify document IDs before bulk inserting

Without this, the JSON sent to CouchDB encodes numeric document
IDs as numbers.  When CouchDB sees this, it complains that
document IDs must be strings.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Very basic view searches work

Good progress on the design document and view APIs

Making the View objects useful so that one can search them
and obtain ViewResult objects is the next step.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Start the new modules and a bit of documentation

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Minor clean up for the public

This is a very slight clean up to add a bit of information
that I thought might be helpful for anyone out there reading
this module.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Create a script for cleaning up after the tests

In some debugging cases, the tests don't clean up after themselves the
way that they should.  Running this script deletes all databases that
were created by the test suite.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Merge branch 'update'

Deleting a document twice is OK

According to a post from Damien Katz (see mid below), double
deletions are OK and might even be useful in some cases.  CouchDB's
revision apparatus does a pretty good job of preventing accidental
deletions.

Ref: mid:F5F0BF09-CAA1-432E-98C3-2A9AD939D857@apache.org

Make request() a mixin method

Many classes will want to use this logic for making requests to
the CouchDB instance.  Using inheritance to make the method
available is wrong because, for instance, a Document is not a DB.

Ideally, Net::CouchDB::Request would be implemented with Class::Trait
or Moose::Role so that the method requirements would be handled
automatically.  I just can't stomach adding a dependency for that
when the user's of this module don't really get anything for it.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Rewrite all_dbs() with the new request interface

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

A new way for making requests to the CouchDB server

The new method request() consolidates much of the code that
is necessary every time we make a request to the server.
This should simplify most methods making it clearer what the
method is actually trying to accomplish.  It will also
make error messages more consistent.

The old call() interface is officially deprecated and generates
ugly warnings if it's used.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Make json() a class method on Net::CouchDB

We only want a single JSON parsing object no matter how many
objects we have floating around.  Giving access to the parser
through a class method makes it more easily accessible to
code no matter where it is.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Test for and fix a typo bug

I spelled "fallback" incorrectly, so using a Document object
in a boolean context caused an exception.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Merge branch 'bulk'

Conflicts:

	lib/Net/CouchDB/DB.pm

Add a test for nonsense bulk operations

Trying to both update and delete the same document doesn't make
sense because CouchDB doesn't promise to perform the several
operations in a certain order.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Add a bit of sugar for bulk insertions

It seems very natural to allow $db->insert() to insert multiple
documents at once as well as single documents.  I emailed the CouchDB
user's mailing list (See mid:20080707220638.GF12208@ginosko.ndrix.org)
to find out whether there's a compelling reason to maintain the direct
PUT/POST way of inserting a single document.  If not, this code can be
simplified a fair amount.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Merge branch 'all_documents'

Implement DB->all_documents

This creates a Document object for every document in the database with
a single HTTP request.  The documents lazily populate themselves as
information is needed.

This needs some refactoring once views are implemented.  $db/_all_docs
is actually just a specially named view (except that it's read-only).

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Make $document->is_deleted consistent

No matter how a document is deleted, the object should be marked
as such.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Finish the basic API for DB->bulk()

This tests almost everything that will be part of the API.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

just a start on the bulk insert/update/delete interface

The bulk() method should return objects for all of the documents that
are inserted.  The document objects that were passed as "delete" and
"update" arguments should be modified in place so that they represent
the newly changed documents.

Perhaps call a method like

    $doc->_you_are_now({ rev => $rev, deleted => 1 })

to tell the documents about their new state.  Document objects should
also have a new method is_deleted() to indicate whether or not they
represent a deleted object.  Try running t/db-bulk.t with DEBUG=1 to
see the HTTP response body and how to proceed.

there should definitely be sugary

    my @new_docs = $db->insert(@hashes);
    $db->delete(@documents)
    $db->update(@documents)

That reminds me, I need to make sure that doing a bunch of operations
in a single bulk() invocation doesn't accomplish anything if there is
one error.

Implement CouchDB::db

This new method allows one to get a database object for a specific
database on the CouchDB server.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Correct the version number regex again

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

The version number format has changed

This new regex might not be general enough to catch all the valid
version numbers.  We'll see what time holds.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Setting DEBUG=1 leaves testing databases in place

It's often helpful, when debugging, to be able to inspect
the CouchDB database after the tests are finished.  By
setting DEBUG=1, the test database is not deleted when the
test ends.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Implement DB->compact to run compaction

This allows one to reduce the size of a database on disk by running
compaction.  It provides both a synchronous and asynchronous mode
of operation.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Allow DB->about to be cached or not

Sometimes it's useful to ask the server for the most recent answer.
Other times, it's OK to receive the answer that was cached earlier.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Add tests for DB->document()

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

More flexible CouchDB version number pattern

In some cases, like when 'svn info' doesn't provide revision
information, the CouchDB version number may not have a trailing
Subversion revision number.  That's OK.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Adjust the expected status code after deletions

As of CouchDB trunk revision 660176, deleting a database or
a document returns HTTP status code 200 instead of 202.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Comment on pieces of the Document->insert tests

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Implement Document->delete

This method lets one delete a document from the database.
Someday, it might be worth making an interface that can
delete documents from the database without first fetching
them.  When that time comes, a DB object can create an
empty Document object and then call this method.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Preliminary implementation of DB->document

This method retrieves a single document from the database based
on the document ID.  I say "preliminary" because there's one TODO
comment and no tests.  They'll be added later, right?

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Document->new should take named arguments

This makes it easier to expand the invocation later when
more flexibility is needed.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Implement $db->insert for creating new documents

This supports creating documents with or without a client-provided
document ID.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

call() methods now support content in the request body

For PUT and POST requests, being able to specify a JSON object
in the request body is necessary before we can create and
update documents in a CouchDB database.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Implement $db->about and related methods

This includes the methods: document_count, deleted_document_count
and disk_size.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Use JSON version 2 for JSON parsing

This module prefers to use JSON::XS if it's available, but
provides a pure Perl implementation for installations that
don't have the faster XS implementation.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Implement CouchDB->about

This method returns CouchDB's generic server meta data which
includes the server version.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

After testing create_db, delete the testing database

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
wip: read these TODO comments to see where to go

Tests for CouchDB::DB->delete

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Write more detailed tests for Net::CouchDB->create_db

This includes tests for the two different kinds of exceptions
that the method can throw.

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Factor out some common testing setup

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Test for connecting to a non-existent database

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>

Document all existing methods

Signed-off-by: Michael Hendricks <michael@ndrix.org>
Clean up POD and remove trailing whitespace

A first shot at Net::CouchDB

This is a fresh rewrite and not based on David Leadbeater's code.

commit.message:
Tidy up plugin exception handling code in the bot

The old version had very long lines, was repetitive, and didn't log
enough information about the exception to debug it.

The new version prints the message and full stack trace, and the code
fits more neatly on my screen.

Move config_var from Bugzilla and Quote plugin into Plugin class

The config_var tool has been handy for processing configuration
parameters for a plugin.  It seems generic enough to roll into the
Plugin class.

Move the config_var class method and the initialize block into the
Plugin class.  Be sure to call "super" from the subclass's initialize
method.  Move the applicable examples into a separate plugin_spec.

Add a OurQuotes plugin to accept and recall quotes and quips

I want to import a collection of quotes from an IRC Eggdrop plugin
and make it accessible over Campfire.

Store changes to the quote archive like the Eggdrop version, and
rebuild an in-memory summary of the log each time a change is made.

Allow adding new quotes with !addquote, removing existing quotes with
!rmquote, and recalling quotes with !quote <id>, !quote <searchstr>,
and !quote.

Set the default quote recall command to be '!ourquote' instead of
'!quote' so it can work out-of-the-box and still avoid clobbering the
previously existing quote plugin.

Add spec for Bugzilla plugin

Show that the Bugzilla plugin actually works with a few examples.

Also add examples for the config_var class method and pending
examples for the HTTP helpers.

Add a GenericSearch plugin to search sites like Google and Wikipedia

This mimicks behavior of several of our eggdrop plugins.

Signed-off-by: Tim Riley <tim@openmonkey.com>

Misc bugzilla plugin enhancents: HTML entities, expiry, regexp configs

* Use HTMLEntities for better decoding of entities than CGI:
  CGI only decodes a few, but HTMLEntities decodes all named entities
  in HTML4 and XHTML1.  KDE's bug tracker has – for example.
  And installation of the htmlentities gem is not required.
* Expire bug timestamps after 2 * min_period to avoid unbounded growth
* Allow configuring of the bug regexps

Signed-off-by: Tim Riley <tim@openmonkey.com>

Port of my irc-bot Bugzilla plugin to Campfire Bot

* Responds to "bug" command
* Scrapes bug title with wget and speaks it to the room
* Notices bug numbers mentioned in casual conversation
* Avoids repeating the same bug in casual conversation too frequently
* Stores last mention time persistently to a file
* Optionally includes a short link to bug
* Several configurable parameters, most notably the bug URL format
* Works with other bug tracking software also

name: gdisk
description: GUID disk partition editor

commit.message: [gdisk.c] Add sanity check so you can't add a partition that overlaps the beginning or end, or has the last and first LBAs reversed.
[bug-changed] Need more mbr tools.
[bug-changed] Need more mbr tools.
[bug-closed] write then quit says "Quitting without saving changes".
[gdisk.c] Only print "Quitting without saving changes" when we really have made changes that haven't been written yet. (Closes: #6dbad788bf1)
[gdisk.c] Fix extra end of line when using "quit" command.
[gdisk.c] Add some paranoid error checking that should never fail.
[gdisk.c] Add "edit-mbr" command which for now only lets you change the MBR partition type. (Re: #c29baa29d)
[gdisk.c] Clarify help on "edit-attributes" command.
[gdisk.c] Add "init-mbr-partition-from-gpt" command which is like init-mbr-from-gpt but merges in a single synced partition. (Re: #c29baa29d)
[gdisk.c] Spelling.
[gdisk.c] Make "new" command work well when you want to use first lba and last lba.

[gdisk.c] Use enums for argument numbers in command_create_partition because there are so many it was confusing.

(What about in the future having an arg() function that you passed strings to, IE arg("type")?)
[gdisk.c] Remove accidentally checked in dead code.
[bug-new] Needs documentation
[bug-new] Bad CRC checksum (rare).
[bug-new] Need more mbr tools.
[bug-new] Command completion on the command line sucks.
[bug-new] write then quit says "Quitting without saving changes".
[bug-closed] 2TB disks show up with negative numbers
[gdisk.c] Print mbr sizes as unsigned so we don't get negative numbers when the disk is too big. (Closes: #b2f1cba1c)
[gdisk.c] Fix missing include.
Add .ditz dir with hooks for git
[bug-new] 2TB disks show up with negative numbers
Add ditz bugs.

[gdisk.c] Add recreate-gpt command that creates the gpt headers from scratch but keeps the current partition entries.
This is for resizing disks or fixing weird errors in existing headers.
[gdisk.c] Fix command_add_protective_mbr_partition returning crap.[gdisk.c] Fix command_add_protective_mbr_partition returning crap.
[gdisk.c] Fixing primary from alternate and alternate from primary was backwards!

[gdisk.c] Fix test for no valid headers.

It was failing when the primary was bad but we hadn't read the secondary
yet.
Merge commit '8ccddd3aef92a35be5aa7d0961730e7d8ab04362'
Merge branches 'master' and 'master' of sa.galvanix.net:src/gdisk
[gdisk] Add "add-protective-mbr-partition" command

[gdisk.c] Find the largest chunk of free space when the user requests a size of zero.
How to document this though!?
[mbr] sectors and first_sector_lba should be unsigned for drives > 1 TB.
[gdisk.c] Update CRCs when editing a partition.
[gdisk.c] Skip huge chunks of zeros when dumping memory.
[round.h] Add round_down().
[gdisk.c] Update the CRCs when adding partitions.
[gdisk.c] Fix CRC errors when reading in a partition table.
[gdisk.c] Add "import" command so that "export" is actually useful.
[mbr.c] Cleanup some stupid memory decisions.
[gdisk.c] Add a way to create the EFI spec's protective MBR.
[gdisk.c] Add --dry-run and --verbose to the write command.

[device] Make sector offsets 64 bits since 32 bits only covers 2TB and we're already there!
Keep sector counts 32 bits because it never makes sense to read or write 2TBs of data at once
[Makefile] Add make TAGS.

[xmem.c] Make xstrcat act like xstrdup when the first argument is NULL.
This allows 'char *x=NULL; while() { x = xstrcat(x, "more"); }' style constructs.
[gdisk.c] Redo command_print() so it's a little more straightforward.
[gdisk.c] Fix GUID always printing the same thing.

[gdisk.c] Revamp read_gpt_table() to be robust against corrupted gpt headers.

(Guess whose Snow Leopard wouldn't install tonight because of a corrupt
Alternate GPT header?)
[gdisk.c] Redo print command in a hopefully easier to extend way.
[gdisk.c] Add trim().
[gdisk.c] Use dalloc when parsing command line.
Add dalloc.c, dalloc.h, an obstack-ish allocator.
[gdisk.c] Fix off-by-one bug when calculating last_lba for a new partition. Ouch.

[gdisk.c] Fix Jim's partition_size_completion() change which worked for completion but broke find_free_space().

1) find_free_space() was comparing blocks against bytes.
2) find_free_sapce() was returning size in bytes instead of first_lba.
[gdisk] complete on the possible partition sizes
[gdisk] appropriate printf formats for sector_count and sector_size
[device-linux] add missing xmem.h include
[device,device-linux] pread/pwrite moved, so move the #define _GNU_SOURCE needed to unhide them

Reverse sector count and start sector in device_read() and device_write().
Now it matches get_sectors(), and makes more sense.

[device] Minimized duplication between osx and linux backends.
Moved file support into device.c, too.
[gdisk.c] Uncomment write since it appears to work now.

[gdisk.c] Add sanity check for when sector size is smaller than 512.
We don't handle that case gracefully yet (though we handle larger ones
just fine).
[xmem] _GNU_SOURCE must be defined to get asprintf()
[gdisk] don't add spaces onto completed command arguments
[gdisk] case insensitive completion of partition types
[gdisk.c] init-from-mbr and sync-mbr -> init-gpt-from-mbr and init-mbr-from-gpt.
[gdisk.c] Add clear-table and clear-mbr to clear the gpt and mbr respectively.
[gdisk.c] Fix mbr_sync calculation--it's not synced if the MBR is empty.
[gdisk.c] Rearrange some utility functions to cut down on forward declarations.
[Makefile] Remove ifdefs and use tricky variables instead.
[xmem] Add xsprintf() and vxsprintf(), x analogs of asprintf() and vasprintf().
[gdisk.h] mbr_sync -> bool for clarity.
[gdisk.c] Try to read the MBR even if we couldn't read the GPT.
[gdisk.c] Speling.
[gdisk.c] Add some warnings for GPT problems that are not fatal.
[gdisk.c] Remove unused g_table_orig.
Move x* memory functions to xmem.[ch]
[gdisk.c] ascat() -> xstrcat(), memdup() -> xmemdup() to match x theme.
[gdisk.c] Add interactive parameters to command line so they go into the history.
[gdisk.c] Add ascat() which strcat that realloc()s to make sure there's room.

[gdisk.c] Use underscores instead of spaces when inputing partition type strings.

Stupid BSD readline to editline wrapper doesn't implement the word
delimiter or quoting options tab completion, so it can never work when
there are spaces in the completion items. Weak.
[gdisk.c] Error on embedded quotes since they don't work.
[gdisk.c] Add basic support for quoted arguments.
[gdisk.c] Avoid some (now) pointless strduping.
[gdisk.c] Add getopt-long style arguments.
Don't great a gpt partition from the filler 0xee mbr partition
Free all args, even the ones after optional args.
Put in a bunch of #warnings to remind me what's left to do.

[gdisk.c] Add "write" command that uses new image structure.

The actual write is commented out since I haven't had the guts to test
it on my disk yet (or the time to set up a clean test).
[gdisk.c] Split export_image() out of export_table().
[gdisk.c] Rewrite export_table() to use new image_from_table() function.
[gdisk.c] Add new image_from_table() function that creates a scatter gather list of partition parts.
[gdisk.c] Add "edit" and "edit-attributes" commands.
[gdisk.c] Split off some validation code for when the user chooses partitions.
[gdisk.c] Don't let utf16_from_ascii() buffer overflow.
[gdisk.c] Whitespace.
[gdisk.c] Change partition_entry_is_representable_in_mbr() since the mbr stores start and length, not start and end.
[gdisk.c] Stop printing statuses. All the commands already print their errors.
[gdisk.c] Add "sync-mbr" command.
[gdisk.c] Pull out some code into new function delete_mbr_partition().
[gdisk.c] Pull out some code into new function sync_partition_to_mbr().
[gdisk.c] Create an alagous MBR entry when we create a new partition and the MBR is currently synced.
[gdisk.c] Don't continue looping when we've found a partition mount (mostly so single-stepping doesn't kill you).
[gdisk.c] Split out some code into new partition_entry_is_representable_in_mbr() function.
[gdisk.c] Use mbr_equivalent field instead of inline table.
[gdisk.c] Make print-mbr only print C:H:S when --verbose is given.
[gdisk.c] Add print-mbr command.

[partition-type] Add list of mbr equivalents to each gpt guid.

Why, oh why does windows not have a 1-to-1 mapping???
[partition-type] Add list of mbr types from linux's fdisk.
Split partition GUIDs into their own file: partition-type.[ch]
[gdisk.c] Keep table crcs up-to-date when editing partition.
[gdisk.c] Update crc api for a little more clarity.
[gdisk.c] Fix partition type completion bug.

[gdisk.c] Delete alias entry when deleting a partition with an mbr alias.
(Otherwise it links back up when you make a new partition in that index)
[gdisk.c] Add "new" command!
[gdisk.c] Add compact-and-sort command.
[gdisk.c] Add delete partition command.
[gdisk.c] Move alias lookup loop out of printing so it's more readable and can be shared.
[gdisk.c] Move alias table creation out of read_table() so it can be shared.
[gdisk.c] Make sure we initialize our optional args.
[gdisk.c] Detect too many arguments to a command.
[guid] Return a "bad guid" from guid_from_string() when string is not parsable rather than printing.
[human.c] Fix off by one bug that the test suite caught.
[human] Add human_size() and test suite.
[human.c] Make sure B lines up with the rest of the units.
Added human_string() which is easier to use (it's csprintf() based).
Move human_format() stuff into it's own file
[guid.[ch]] Add guid_from_string() for parsing guids.
Add and use guid_create().
Make GUIDs a structure so you can use them as l and rvalues.
Add guid_eq() function for better readability.
[gdisk.c] Tweak prompts and help so help look good in both help and prompts.
[gdisk.c] No need to do interactive flags since you can now only put them on the command line.
[gdisk.c] Use find_command() in run_command().
[gdisk.c] Don't prompt for optional parameters. Those *must* come on the command line now.
[gdisk.c] Add detailed help for individual commands.
[gdisk.c] Sort the list of commands in the help.
[gdisk] Autodetect help width.
[gdisk] Make flag parameters optional.
[gdisk.c] Parse command line. Now you can put arguments on the command line.
[gdisk.c] Add xrealloc() to match other x*() functions.
[gdisk.c] Split command line "parsing" into its own function. This cleans things up a lot.
[Makefile] Mac OS X has libuuid built-in somehow (and not available separately).
[Makefile] Make LDLIBS specific to target.
function and command to convert from an mbr to a gpt
use e2fstools' uuid generation for now
init the alias array when creating a blank_table()
[main] print white space clearly on command errors
use structure assignment instead of memcpy for clarity
make sure to allocate/free space of the name, the args and the null
[device-linux] support opening plain files as well as disks
slightly clearer alias array length
check the crcs when reading an warn when they are wrong
rename partition_crc to partition_crc32 for consistency with header_crc32
[gpt.h] pack gpt_header to avoid structure alignment padding on 64 bit machines
[Makefile] add command line modifiable DEBUG varaible
[Makefile] LDLIBS is for libs, not LDFLAGS
[gdisk.c] Last usable LBA wasn't taking the alternate GPT header sector into account.
[gdisk.c] Handle empty MBR partitions when checking if MBR and GPT partitions are synced.
[gdisk.c] Fix closing a file twice (and one not at all).
[gdisk.c] More GPT header sanity checks.
[gdisk.c] Less copy and paste for gpt header sanity check errors.
[Makefile] On Mac OS X, use old readline names since BSD hasn't caught up with GNU.
[Makefile] Move platform detection to its own variable.
[gdisk.c] Make alt header stuff look better when creating a blank table.
[gdisk.c] Fix alternate header partition table lba pointer not pointing to second partition table.
BLKGETSIZE64 returns bytes not sectors
Check signature of header (and alternate) before using them
Include <stdarg.h> for va_start()
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/caldwell/gdisk
readline's filename_completion_function() is deprecated
Define _GNU_SOURCE for asprintf()
Add a .gitignore file
Group the command_args using command_args() in command_add()
Use <intypes.h>'s beautiful PRI*64 macros for portability
Use correct print format for size_t
Include readline/history.h as we use things from it
Fix the program name in the usage
Add Linux support
[Makefile] autodetect the os type
[endian.h] Byte swap macros for cross platformness.
Add dup_table() helper function (though I don't have a use for it yet).
Add backup_table() which stores a backup of your partition table in your home directory.
Add "export" command.
Add export_table() function which writes a partition table to a set of files.
Convert gpt partition to host byte order after reading.
Add partition_sectors() convenience function.
Make a blank table if a valid signature can't be found on the disk.
Better errno value when dying.
Add csprintf to Makefile.
Add in good old hacky csprintf.
Add some routines that translate the gpt header from disk byte order to host byte order and back.

Add mbr_from_sector() and sector_from_mbr().
This is so we can read and write to somewhere other than sector 0
(like import and export).
Use calloc for allocating sectors so we can start with a blank partition table easier.
Add completion for command partiton argument types.
Do filename completion when the command type is a file.
Add File and Partition command parameter types.

Add a help parameter to the command arguments.
This makes for a nicer UI.
[gdisk.c] Handle flag parameters nicely.
[gdisk.c] Add command completion to readline. Yay!

[gdisk.c] Put command name in arg[0] to be more conventional.
(plus it makes arg[1] read a little better)
[gdisk.c] Use xcalloc instead of calloc to eliminate stupid error checking.
[gdisk.c] Add some useful little library routines.
[gdisk.c] Make debug dump functions static.
[mbr.c] Fix data corruption errors in mbr read/write routines.
[Makefile] Use $(TARGETS) instead of direct name for better generality.
Split out quiet rules into their own Makefile as they are generic.

[gdisk.c] Add "print" command to print the partition.

(The first real command. Yay!)
Add the name of the device we opened so we can print it later, just for fun.
[gdisk.c] Add commands for all the debug print functions we have.

Move all partition table structures into a global "struct partition_table". I'd
prefer it wasn't global but the alternative is to have all the commands get it
passed to them and that just seems excessive. If that becomes an issue later we
can always change it...
[gdisk.c] Add 'quit' command.
[gdisk.c] Error message when a invalid command is typed.
add_command() -> command_add() for better match autolist conventions.
[gdisk.c] Add simple help command.

Add very simple command infrastructure.

Added autolist and readline as dependencies.
[gdisk.c] Add code to detect a synced MBR. Ideally we'll keep it synced.
[gdisk.c] Remove prototype that is now in device.h.

First draft of gdisk.

Right now it only loads a gpt and mbr partition table into memory and
dumps it.

Moved plugin loading logic into BuilderPlugin; environment now responsible for loading all plugins.

Project#notify raises an exception if you try to notify plugins of an event that hasn't been documented in BuilderPlugin. Not coincidentally, BuilderPlugin now provides documentation and an interface for all event callbacks.

commit.message: Add id to packagemaker command; add macosx_version_min to ld_options for package configure
Make cabal2macpkg do profiling
For metapackages, just dump out the .pkg files into a folder instead of fruitlessly trying to build a broken installer

More work on cabal2macpkg -- partial support for haskell platform

Meta mode is still broken, but as of this changeset it does enough to
generate .pkg files for the haskell platform (which you still need to
assemble into a distribution by hand, augh)
First draft of .pkg support for Leopard

Cabal2macpkg now works with Tiger-format .mpkg files.

Unfortunately I've discovered that this is useless, you can't mix Tiger-format
and Leopard-format .pkg files in a Tiger-format .mpkg. I'll have to rework the
program to speak Leopard-formatted files -- there's some reverse-engineering to
be done there since Apple's doco is so poor.

IM A GEM BUILDING MACHINE

Minor refactoring of Delayed::Job.enqueue to DRY up handling of EvaledJobs
Made a gem out of delayed_job so I can use it in my services. Had to modify Worker to not infer DJ is running in a Rails instance.
Factored duplication out of Job#deserialize. Made roodi happier about its cyclomatic complexity as well.
Added eval jobs as a low ceremony way of declaring jobs without an explicit class (poor man's block marshalling)

adding new un-finished specs
Fixing expectation in spec.
more specs around poping jobs off the queue.
active record changes and fixing some small bugs.
Whoops, wrong variable name in that last commit.
Extract log_exception method so that applications can use it as a hook to supply custom exception logging/notification, like Hoptoad for example.

Fix issues with last merge in relation to jobs:work task

Need to use .new(options).start now
Worker::say needed to be moved into the proper scope

Merge branch 'master' into jbarnette/master

Conflicts:

	tasks/jobs.rake

Added min/max priority levels for workers. This allows you to have dedicated workers to high priority task
This is useful when you need to DJ a lot of tasks that need to be run quickly such as things that affect the UI like image transformations.
Dedicate some workers to high priority jobs only when you have a lot of long running low priority tasks that could otherwise clog all the workers.
add documentation and rename destroy_jobs to the more descriptive destroy_failed_jobs
test both sides of destroy_jobs behavior
whether or not jobs should be destroyed is now configurable (old jobs are destroyed by default)

Changes extracted from GitHub:

- Add failed_at to schema
- Rather than destroying a job, set its failed_at when it retries too many times.
- Take failed_at into account when finding potential jobs
- Include the backtrace in the logged last_error
- Make MAX_RUN_TIMES a constract

Job#find_available does not return running jobs

Make sure that jobs that have not expired are not being returned by
Job#find_available.
allow Delayed::PerformableMethod to work with class methods.  Foo.send_later :process, id
merge

Refactored jobs:work, added jobs:clear.

  - added Rake descriptions
  - factored jobs:work into Delayed::Worker for reuse in scripts
  - updated the README to suggest using Delayed::Worker.new.start
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/jbarnette/delayed_job into jbarnette/master
Update the README's create_table to match the schema.
update delayed job schema in the readme
make tests run over 2x faster by creating the test db just once
remove excess whitespace
get specs to run
Fixed a nasty bug that allowed several job runners to get the exclusive lock to the same job
Renamed locked_until to locked_at. We now store when we start a given task instead of how long it will be locked by the worker. This allows us to get a reading on how long a task took to execute.
Lock for 4 hours and not 5 mins
Fix spelling mistake
Don't save jobs with empty handlers
More formatting updates for readme
Lets try this again as textile instead of markdown
Renamed README to README.markdown for github formatting action
Small corrections for the included rake task

Removed the global lock. Jobs can now processed in parallel by running multiple job runners on the same machine or across your server farm.
This requires two new columns in the job table: locked_by and locked_until
Increase job rescheduling timeouts
Initial extraction

Fix up relative links in item body

Fix up relative links in item body

Some feed items have relative links in their body. When fastladder is
running on http://example.com and a feed item contains a relative link
`/foo/bar`, the link will be resolved wrongly into http://example.com/foo/bar .
Relative links should be resolved with its feed link.

issue.title: Use secrets.yml instead secret_token.rb
issue.body:
Since Rails v4.1.0, config/initializers/secret_token.rb is removed
and load secret_key_base from config/secret.yml.
(see: rails/rails #13298
- rewrite "rake setup" task to write a token to config/secrets.yml.
- add "config/secrets.yml" to .gitignore because it has token directly.

**CAUTION**: Maybe these changes break user's deployment script.

issue.title: add dependent option to has_one/has_many association.
issue.body:
basically, `dependent: :delete_all`.
Subscription model has after_destroy callback.
so `Member#subscriptions` and `Feed#subscriptions` associations with `dependent: :destroy`.

---

has_one 関連は `dependent: :destroy`。
has_many 関連は 1 件ずつ destroy していると不要な負荷を与えるので基本的には `dependent: :delete_all`。
before_destroy, after_destroy callback を子の側で使っている場合のみ
`dependent: :destroy` にするという方針で設定しました。

issue.title: Modernize JavaScript
issue.body:
コードをざっと眺めて、適当に懸念をいくつか
## サポートブラウザは？

レガシーブラウザ対応でJSの見通しが非常に悪い。
IE6対応コードを落とせばすっきりするし、むしろそろそろjQueryのサポートがなくなるIE8も切っていいんじゃないか。
ECMA5互換のAPIについては、es5shimを導入してすっきりしたい(管理コストとarray_extraが書かれた時代に対する不安)

https://github.com/kriskowal/es5-shim
## 名前空間

最初に書かれた時代によると思うがグローバルに関数が定義されすぎている。
LDReaderかFlに寄せたい。

require.jsがモダンなみたいな風潮はあるけどたぶん超しゃらくさいし面倒なだけな気がする。
## テスト

JSのテストは書くのか、書くとしたらどこまでカバーするのか
何年も動いてきたという実績はあるので、あえて切り捨てて、新規実装分だけやればいい気がする　リファクタは気合いになるが
## 外部ライブラリ

外部ライブラリはどの程度導入するのか(malaさんがえいって書いたっぽいところをどこまで保持するか)

Backbone等MVCはどうなのか。習熟・学習コストの点でやりづらそうな気はするが、Backboneぐらい薄いなら問題な気もする。でもそうなると勝手にunderscoreとかjQueryがついてきて面倒。
プロジェクトの指針としてcoffee-scriptは受け入れるのか。

以上です。

issue.title: Can't get this to run properly in OS X 10.7/Xcode 4
IB plugin fails to load with IB 3.2.x
issue.body:
The PSMTabBar's IB plugin fails to load with IB 3.2.x, throwing this error warning:

**The document “PSMTabBar.ibplugin” could not be opened. The bundle is damaged or missing necessary resources.**
Try reinstalling the bundle.

issue.title: Merged other fork improvements and added statistics
issue.body: Updated for modern Rake and Bundler compatibility as well.

issue.title: Double-require overwrites aliased class method
issue.body: cache_class_method short-circuits if the method has already been aliased to the cached proxy.  This is problematic because if you require the same file twice, the second pass will overwrite the aliased method with the original definition, thereby eliminating the caching altogether.
